wikipedia_page.main: Thomas John Burgoyne (1775 – 20 October 1847) was an English first-class cricketer who made 24 known appearances from 1796 to 1816. His place of birth is Marylebone; he died in London. He was mainly associated with Middlesex. He played for the Gentlemen in the second Gentlemen v Players match in 1806.

response: * Thomas Burgoyne junior (1805–1879), his son, English cricketer
* Thomas Burgoyne (Australian politician) (1827–1920), builder and politician in the colony of South Australia
*Thomas Burgoyne (Bere Alston MP), member of parliament for Bere Alston
*Thomas Burgoyne (Cambridgeshire MP), member of parliament for Cambridgeshire

Thomas Burgoyne junior (30 December 1805 – 12 October 1879) was an English first-class cricketer active 1835–41 who played for Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC). The son of Thomas Burgoyne, he was born in Westminster and died in Chart, Surrey. He appeared in four first-class matches.Thomas Burgoyne at CricketArchive
